alert.note: Alert for Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 5:58PM EDT until June 22 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MASON...SOUTHERN BROWN AND WEST CENTRAL ADAMS COUNTIES... At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Ripley, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Georgetown, West Union, Ripley, Aberdeen, Decatur, Russellville, Dover, Redoak, Moranburg, Lake Waynoka, Bradysville, Bentonville, South Ripley and Tuckahoe. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
